text:
I am using JuliaPro and would like to add Revise to startup.jl. The only startup.jl file I find points me to another place but there is no "config\startup.jl":
# DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE, Use <HOME-DIRECTORY>\\.julia\\config\\startup.jl instead

elements.text:
I am using JuliaPro and would like to add Revise to startup.jl. The only startup.jl file I find points me to another place but there is no "config\startup.jl":
# DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE, Use <HOME-DIRECTORY>\\.julia\\config\\startup.jl instead

text: It doesn't exist by default, you can create it yourself

elements.text: It doesn't exist by default, you can create it yourself

text: And this new file can have only one line "using Revise" or do I have also to copy the contents other file (located in  ../etc/julia)

elements.text: And this new file can have only one line "using Revise" or do I have also to copy the contents other file (located in  ../etc/julia)

text: I'm actually not sure, I don't know if Julia overlays the files or only uses one with "highest priority". Also not sure if JuliaPro has important stuff in its startup file. It seems like it would be silly for them to depend on their users not having their own startup file. I'd recommend trying to just put `using Revise` in your own file and see if everything still works.

elements.text: I'm actually not sure, I don't know if Julia overlays the files or only uses one with "highest priority". Also not sure if JuliaPro has important stuff in its startup file. text: (you could test the behaviour by putting something like `print("/etc")` and `print("mine")` in the two files, starting Julia, and seeing what gets printed out)
